definitions: To fix or mark with a peg.
To attach or secure with pegs.
To keep (a price, rate, or level) at a particular level; fix.
To throw (a ball or other object) with a strong, swift motion.
examples: He pegged the tent to the ground.
They pegged the price of the dollar.
She pegged him as a troublemaker.
The catcher pegged the runner at second base.
